article.p: The bmigrate utility simulates the island model of evolutionary algorithms, allowing for real-time visualisation, analysis, and control. It is an ISC licensed GTK application running on UNIX systems. At its simplest, bmigrate orchestrates simultaneous simulations consisting of repeated simulation runs. Each run is a sequence of generations over a finite set of islands.

figure.figcaption: In each generation, (1) each island's individuals reproduce with a Poisson process with a mean of the individual's utility function. The offspring then (2) migrate to an island (which may be the birth island). On each island, (3) a single native individual and (4) single immigrant individual are selected, then the native individual is (5) replaced by the immigrant. The remaining immigrants are discarded, keeping islands' populations constant.

article.p: The system has an extensive manual. Beyond how to deploy and operate the system, the manual describes topics like parallelism, data-flow, randomness, precision, and so forth. The following are a set of screenshots of the system in motion. Each view is documented in the Views section of the manual.
